com.fluidops.iwb.user
Class UserManagerImpl

java.lang.Object
  com.fluidops.iwb.user.UserManagerImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
UserManager, java.rmi.Remote
public class UserManagerImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements UserManager

Default implementation of the IWB user management. Grants almost full rights to every user. The ACL user approach is implemented in fiwbcom, class AclUserManagerImpl (which in parts makes use of convenience methods defined here, such as user name and URI access).

Author:
msc

Method Detail

hasQueryPrivileges

public boolean hasQueryPrivileges(java.lang.String query,
                                  ReadDataManagerImpl.SparqlQueryType qt,
                                  java.lang.String securityToken)
Convenience method to determine if user has query privileges, which can be used from servlets, i.e. SparqlServlet or HybridSearchServlet. Informally the user is allowed to submit a query if either a valid security token is provided (only SELECT/CONSTRUCT), or the user has access on ACL level. Note that regardless of ACL access rights the endpoint can be disabled using Config.getPublicSparqlEndpointEnabled(). Formally access is granted, if one of the following holds a) query is null or empty, or query type is null (e.g. keyword query) b) Config.getServletSecurityKey() is null or empty (= default for IWB CE) and query is not UPDATE or ASK c) securityToken matches the hash generated from query and Config.getServletSecurityKey() and query is not UPDATE or ASK d) access has been granted on ACL level (default is true in IWB CE) and Config.getPublicSparqlEndpointEnabled() is true

Specified by:
hasQueryPrivileges in interface UserManager
Parameters:
query -
qt -
securityToken - the security token (as-is) from the request, is URL decoded internally
Returns:

Description copied from interface: UserManager
To be called prior to executing an API method. If the user does not have access to the API, then an exception will be thrown.

Specified by:

sc - optional context to register against, if null user context is used
Returns:

hasServletAccess

public boolean hasServletAccess(java.lang.Class<?> servletClass,
                                com.fluidops.api.security.SessionContext sc)
Description copied from interface: UserManager
To be called in each servlet prior to delivering data. Not sure if we want to have it, but it may be a usefool tool to disable some servlets for users (e.g., RDF Export). However, components that rely on the servlets may break. Therefore, you should use this feature with care and basically allow all the components to every user.

Specified by:
hasServletAccess in interface UserManager
Parameters:
servletClass - the servlet class
sc - optional context to register against, if null user context is used
Returns:
true if and only if user has access to the the given servlet class according to the access rules

getUserURI

public org.openrdf.model.URI getUserURI(com.fluidops.api.security.SessionContext sc)
Description copied from interface: UserManager
Get the user's URI. The users URI is the global identifier for the user and identifies its profile page. Implementation should *always* return a valid URI (not null, user Vocabulary.SYSTEM.UNKNOWN_USER as a fallback when the user is not known (or not logged in).

Specified by:
getUserURI in interface UserManager
Parameters:
sc - optional context to register against, if null user context is used
Returns:
the URI of the user
